title: William Caldwell Murder Investigation

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: William Caldwell Murder Investigation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

William Caldwell was murdered in September 1975 in Jefferson Parish. The two court cases are 781987 : The State of Louisiana Vs Anthony P Johnson, Frances Caldwell, and Ellis Charles Landix and 791545: The State of Louisiana Vs The State of Louisiana Vs Anthony P Johnson, Frances Caldwell, and Ellis Charles Landix.  I would like all the documents for the William "Billy" Caldwell murder investigation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tammy Mercure

title: FOIA Devereaux Knox Vietnam War  ST-2

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Devereaux Knox Vietnam War  ST-2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

OMPF for Devereaux Knox including cumulative record of training, history of assignments, military education, transfers and receipts, all military decorations and citations, personnel evaluations, unit awards, deployments South Vietnam.
1) History of Assignments NAVPERS form 601-5
2) Navy Occupational training history NAVPERS 601-4
3) Cumulative transfers and receipts NAVPERS 601-12, administrative remarks
4) Bronze Star Medal award citations, Navy Commendation Medal citations
Retired Master Chief MMCM, retired 1988. Awards include Bronze Star Medal with Combat V, Navy Commendation Medal, Combat Action Ribbon, good conduct medal, Presidential Unit Citation, Navy Unit Commendation, Vietnam Service Medal. Service with ST-2 SEAL TEAM TWO  Vietnam Conflict 1967 to 1969, UDT-21. Training includes Underwater Demolition Team Replacement UDTR training, Basic Airborne School, SERE, 5321 UDT Swimmer, 5326 Navy SEAL.
Passed away Thursday, May 20, 2010.

Please redact any sensitive information protected in accordance with the Privacy Act of 1974.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Eric Bradley

title: Any Florida Attorney General Documents that would Identify Any State Of Florida Agencies Required By Law To Investigate Organized Crime in Florida.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any Florida Attorney General (hereafter FLAG) documents that would identify any State of Florida entities required by law to investigate the alleged operation of organized crime syndicates or white collar organized crime syndicates operating in Florida, targeting Florida residents.
2. Any FLAG documents used to define (definition for) the phrase "organized crime" in the State of Florida.
3. Any FLAG documents used to define (definition for) the phrase " white color organized crime" in the State of Florida.
4. A copy of any FL AG policy/protocol for representing non-Florida politicians in federal court, who have alleged ties to organized crime.
5. A copy of any FLAG policy/protocol for representing non-Florida politicians in federal court, who are involved in alleged "Fraud on the Court" schemes.
  (Definition for Fraud on the Court)The requisite fraud on the court occurs where “it can be demonstrated, clearly and convincingly, that a party has sentiently set in motion some unconscionable scheme calculated to interfere with the judicial system’s ability impartially to adjudicate a matter by improperly influencing the trier of fact or unfairly hampering the presentation of the opposing party’s claim or defense.” Aoude v. Mobil Oil Corp., 892 F.2d 1115, 1118 (1st Cir. 1989). . . .:
6. Any FLAG documents that would exempt Lawyers employed by FLAG office from compliance with Florida Bar, Rules of Professional Conduct https://www-media.floridabar.org/uploads/2023/06/Ch-4.pdf
6. Any documents of the vetting of Robert Butterworth, for FLAG.
7. Any documents of the FLAG for the vetting of Scott Masel for head of Florida Attorney General office CIVIL Division, Ft. Lauderdale.
8. Any documents of the FLAG for the vetting of the female (Scott Masel's counterpart) for head of Florida Attorney General office CRIMINAL Division, Ft. Lauderdale.
9. Any FLAG documents on a Richard McCleary drug trafficking operation out of Florida, Vero Beach or Key West,Florida to Maryland, Ocean City or Salisbury)
10. Any FLAG investigation into Florida Dept. of Law Enforcement employees, Michael Ramage, David Sessions, Tim Elder, or Michael Washam.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Don Stone

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Communications with Gov.'s Office over Budget cut and CEO change at Georgia Public Broadcasting
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails, text messages and other communications regarding budget cuts, layoffs, programming changes, and the executive director retirement, interim appointment, and permanent replacement search at Georgia Public Broadcasting from April 1, 2023 to the present. 

This would include any communications between the Office of Gov. and members of the Georgia Public Telecommunications Commission (Brian Dill, Jerald Mitchell, Cecil Staton), executives at GPB (gpb.org) including Teya Rayn, Bert Wesley Huffman, Elizabeth Laprade, Bill Nigut, and employees of the Atlanta Journal-Constitution (employees possessing email addresses that end in @ajc.com), Cox Media Group (@cmg.com or @coxmediagroup.com), and Cox Enterprises (@coxinc.com, @cox.com, and @coxenterprises.com).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Tos Violation

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tos Violation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Expedited handling requested

I was seeking a copy of the annual code of conduct affirmation that is signed by each EOUSA or USAO employee to comply with the standards of conduct outlaid by the Department of Justice including but not limited to: 1-4.200 - Allegations of Misconduct by Department of Justice Employees—General Considerations etc.

Justification for expedited handling:  By EOUSA FOIA volition a pattern of requests has been overturned by the DOJ OIP, this casts a reasonable doubt in relation to morale with the EOUSA and its ethics in handling FOIA/PA on behalf of the United States and its management of the FOIA/PA or lack thereof.  I wish to urgently educate the public about the operations of EOUSA and ensure that any young person who would endeavor to pursue a career in civil service be aware of the guidelines for performance that it includes.  

Fee Waiver:
Not requested.  This document should be a common document in every EOUSA personnel file. I do not think the search should exceed the free time allowed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Fernandes

title: Carl S. Bat

communications.communication:
Dear National Park Service:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED:

I am seeking records related to NPS mascot Carl S. Bat, mascot for Carlsbad Caverns National Park.

Specifically, I request the following records:

1. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, and design/re-design of the Carl S. Bat mascot. Please include any contracts or design concepts (e.g. sketches) in your production, as well as any records related to NPS's decision to create a mascot for Carlsbad Caverns in the first place.

2. Please produce all Carl S. Bat-related promotional items, educational items, or tchotchkes, past or present, that took the form of records, such as trading cards, posters, videos, worksheets, or books (including but not limited to coloring books, activity books, or comic books).

3. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, design, and use of any wearable Carl S. Bat costumes. (The attached screenshots from NPS's social media suggest that Carl's costume got an update sometime between 2014 and 2022, so please produce records for the different versions.) Responsive records would include contracts for the design or production of such a costume; design proposals or sketches; correspondence with the designer or manufacturer; and any guidelines related to the use of or care for the costume.

4. Please produce all communications related to Carl S. Bat.

5. Please produce all correspondence related to Carl S. Bat (or to mascots in general) sent to or from any member of Congress, their office, or their staff. Senator Tom Coburn (R-OK) may have sent some responsive correspondence around 2007, and Senator Joni Ernst (R-IA) may have sent some around 2019. 

6. Please produce all records related to any proposal or decision to stop using Carl S. Bat as part of NPS's public outreach.

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

All records from the Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD) on the Unconventionally-acquired Brain Injury (UBI) OSD Working Group. This investigatory body is identified in a brochure for an October 2020 virtual conference titled Women Empowered to Engage, published by the Career Communications Group. One of the speakers at this event, Ms. Stephanie Miller, Chief of the Bioeffects Division, Air Force Research Laboratory, is listed as the co-chair of the UBI OSD Working Group, confirming the existence of such a body. I am attaching a copy of the brochure but for clarity's sake, I am reproducing the link here as well (please see Ms. Miller's biography on page 2): https://issuu.com/rjkennedy/docs/woc20_empowered_1

This request includes, but is not limited to:

- Correspondence, i.e., email, physical letters, faxed communications, etc.

- Memorandums

- Catalogs

- Briefing cards

- Audio/visual materials

- Preliminary and Final Assessments/Reports

- Consensus, Position, and White Papers

I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. My bylines, which include Creem Magazine, Covert Action Magazine, and Philly Voice, can be found in both print and electronic publications. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

A fee waiver is appropriate in situations where "disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of the government, and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester,” 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(iii). This request would contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations and activities of government with regard to its research into the physical effects of directed energy attacks, as currently there is a concern among the members of the media and the public about so-called anomalous health incidents, aka unconventionally-acquired brain injuries, aka Havana Syndrome.

Anomalous health incidents are events occurring between 2016 and the present day that have resulted in a condition, or a series of related conditions, afflicting intelligence agents and diplomats working for the governments of the United States and Canada. In 2016, the Associated Press reported on a number of such incidents that happened in Cuba that led to the United States pulling staff from its embassy in that country. Since that time, anomalous health incidents have continued to generate media attention in major new outlets, with stories focusing on the national security implications appearing in the New York Times and The New Yorker, among many other publications. Speculation presently focuses on the use of directed energy weapons, or ranged weapons that attack a target with electromagnetic radiation like ultra-high frequency radio waves, as one possible cause for anomalous health incidents.

As of 2023, there have been at least 200 reported anomalous health incidents, with many of the victims stating they were subject to attacks by directed energy weapons. Given that most of these individuals have been identified as high-ranking officials across multiple federal agencies, any programs or investigatory bodies convened to investigate anomalous health incidents and/or the effects of directed energy on humans would be the subject of considerable public interest. This is especially important in light of the fact that both Congress and the President approved compensation in the range of $140,000 or $187,000 per person to individuals diagnosed as suffering from anomalous health incidents, under the HAVANA Act of 2021.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

title: Association of New Jersey Rifle and Pistol Clubs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Association of New Jersey Rifle and Pistol Clubs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry of Association of New Jersey Rifle and Pistol Clubs, Inc. (aka ANJRPC),  the New Jersey chapter of the National Rifle Association.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: Use of force records for 4 institutions, January 2020

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Use of force records for 4 institutions, January 2020
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records for all incidents that involved uses of force on inmates, occurring in January 2020, for the following facilities:
California Medical Facility (CMF)
Central California Women’s Facility (CCWF)
High Desert State Prison (HDSP)
Kern Valley State Prison (KVSP)

Please provide the following records, both disciplinary and non-disciplinary, for these incidents:

1. Incident report forms (CDCR 837 Crime/Incident Report Forms)
2. Incidents involving use of force on inmates that were documented in the Incident Report Tracking (IRT) system in the Department’s electronic database rather than using CDCR 837 Forms.
3. All use of force review forms (CDCR Form 3010 Incident Commander's Review/Critique Use of Force Incidents).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

John Lindsay-Poland

title: Case Number 0639-19 Police Report and Body Cam Footage Request

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Case Number 0639-19 Police Report and Body Cam Footage Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Tennessee Open Records Act, §10-7-503 et seq., I am requesting misconduct police records of the Memphis Police, specifically case number 0639-19. The officers involved in this incident were John Griffin, Randall Schmidt, Russell Cathey, and Patric Ferguson. My request includes but is not limited to documents, reports, multimedia, body-worn camera footage, arrest filings, and other documentation linked to the incident. It also includes all documents, notes, correspondence, and memoranda evidencing sustained findings reports, and investigations, and all communication and correspondence in whatever tangible medium between the officials, the victims, and the overseeing agency.

As per law, police misconduct records are public records and do not qualify for any exemption, and are not listed as confidential records.

This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

The Tennessee Open Records Act requires a response time within seven days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at shaynacf@stanford.edu or my colleague, Eric Sagara at esagara@stanford.edu or his phone number, (520)275-7506.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Shayna Freedman.

title: 2017 Columbus Scioto 6-12 Gunfire Incident

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: 2017 Columbus Scioto 6-12 Gunfire Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The incident report and any investigative reports, including supplements such as police narratives, produced in relation to the shooting incident at Columbus Scioto 6-12 on 9/8/2017 either a full, partial, or release of the report.

In the event that there are fees, I would request a waiver, as I am a member of a nonprofit media outlet and these records will be used in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

I would prefer the request filed electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,
Daniella Jimenez
Investigative Reporting Workshop.
